fields.title: bias-variance decomposition
fields.pointers:
* The variance term depends on the  [effective number of parameters](effective_num_parameters)  of a model.
*  [Statistical learning theory](statistical_learning_theory)  gives a way of analyzing bias and variance of estimators more generally.
*  [Cross-validation](cross_validation)  is a simple and general technique for managing the bias-variance tradeoff.  [ (go to concept)](cross_validation)
fields.summary: The bias-variance decomposition (often referred to as the bias-variance tradeoff) is a frequentist analysis of the generalization capability of an estimator, i.e. a learning algorithm.
